unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Traction in Karnataka**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Traction in Karnataka**

unnormalised: Bangalore, Karnataka – The Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation Limited (KPTCL) is accelerating the deployment of smart meters across the state, aiming to improve billing accuracy and reduce power theft. As of today, pilot projects are underway in several districts, including Belgaum and Mysore, with positive initial feedback from consumers.
normalised: Bangalore, Karnataka – The Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation Limited (K P T C L) is accelerating the deployment of smart meters across the state, aiming to improve billing accuracy and reduce power theft. As of today, pilot projects are underway in several districts, including Belgaum and Mysore, with positive initial feedback from consumers.

unnormalised: The initiative, a part of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS), seeks to replace conventional meters with smart meters for all electricity consumers by 2025. These advanced meters provide real-time data on energy consumption, enabling better grid management and facilitating time-of-use tariffs. This allows consumers, like those in Malleswaram, to manage their electricity usage and potentially lower their bills.
normalised: The initiative, a part of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (R D S S), seeks to replace conventional meters with smart meters for all electricity consumers by two thousand and twenty five. These advanced meters provide real-time data on energy consumption, enabling better grid management and facilitating time-of-use tariffs. This allows consumers, like those in Malleswaram, to manage their electricity usage and potentially lower their bills.

unnormalised: "We are committed to ensuring seamless integration of smart meters," stated Mr. Rajesh Sharma, Managing Director of KPTCL, during a press conference held at 11:00 hrs on 10/11/2024. Concerns raised by resident welfare associations in areas like Jayanagar are being actively addressed.

unnormalised: The project is expected to cost approximately Rs. 5000 crores and is partly funded by the central government. A consumer awareness campaign is scheduled to begin on 20/11/2024, with workshops in Kannada and English planned at 15:00 hrs daily, explaining the benefits and functionalities of the new meters.
